com.flir.flironesdk

Class Device

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flir.flironesdk.Device
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EmbeddedDevice, FlirUsbDevice

    public abstract class Device
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    Represents a connected FLIR device, including the methods for interacting and capturing images and videos from it.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Device.BatteryChargingState
      Represents the state of the device battery.
      static interface  Device.Delegate
      Defines callback methods for device state updates
      static interface  Device.PowerUpdateDelegate
      Power-specific callback methods
      static interface  Device.StreamDelegate
      Defines callback method for handling stream capture events
      static class  Device.TuningState
      Represents the state of the flat-field calibration tuning

    • Method Detail

      • getSupportedDeviceClasses

        public static final java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<? extends Device>> getSupportedDeviceClasses(Context context)
        Gets a set of Device subclasses that are supported by the SDK on the current host.
        Parameters:
        context - used to check for connectivity support.
        Returns:
        Set of Classes that could be passed to Device.Delegate.onDeviceConnected(Device)

      • startFrameStream

        public abstract void startFrameStream(Device.StreamDelegate delegate)
        Call this method after onDeviceConnected has been called on the device delegate to start frame streaming. This method will have no effect if called before the device is ready
        Parameters:
        delegate - the callback delegate object

      • stopFrameStream

        public abstract void stopFrameStream()
        Call this method to stop frame streaming This method will have no effect if called if frames are not streaming

      • startDiscovery

        public static void startDiscovery(Context context,
                                  Device.Delegate delegate)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Call this method to connect to a FLIR One device, typically you should call this from your activity's onResume method, passing your app context and device delegate. This will start a broadcast receiver listening for connected devices. It will call the delegate's deviceDiscovered method when one is created this way
        Parameters:
        context - The application or activity context, used for registering broadcast receiver. Note: an Activity context is needed for CAT S60
        delegate - The delegate for discovered devices to be created with
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When called multiple times in succession without calling stopDiscovery

      • stopDiscovery

        public static void stopDiscovery()
        Call this method during onStop to stop listening for devices connected over USB. This prevents the current app from capturing connection events in the background, when other apps may need to receive them.

      • isExternal

        public static boolean isExternal()
        Returns:

      • setPowerUpdateDelegate

        public abstract void setPowerUpdateDelegate(Device.PowerUpdateDelegate powerUpdateDelegate)
        If the device has a battery, power status updates will be sent to the power update delegate
        Parameters:
        powerUpdateDelegate - The object to receive power updates

      • performTuning

        public abstract void performTuning()
        Call this method if tuning is required or requested for high thermal accuracy
        See Also:
        Device.TuningState

      • setAutomaticTuning

        public abstract void setAutomaticTuning(boolean shouldAutomaticallyTune)
        Disable or enable the automatic tuning feature of the device. The device defaults to automatic tuning being enabled.
        Parameters:
        shouldAutomaticallyTune - Set to false to keep the automatic tuning function from being performed. Set to true to re-enable.

      • close

        public abstract void close()
        This method disconnects the device. Note that stopDiscovery() will automatically close the device for you, so it is usually not necessary to call this method directly.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable

      • hasBattery

        public abstract boolean hasBattery()
        Indicates whether the device has its own battery
        Returns:
        the presence of a battery

      • hasTorch

        public boolean hasTorch()
        Indicates whether the device has a torch (flashlight) control. If false, use whatever flashlight is available to the host, for example the Android Camera APIs. If true, the device either has its own torch or controls access to the host torch.
        Returns:
        the presence of a flashlight AKA torch.

      • setTorchMode

        public void setTorchMode(boolean enabled)
        If hasTorch returns true, this method will toggle the torch, AKA flashlight.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if the torch should be turned on, false if it should be turned off.

      • getUpperAccuracyBound

        public float getUpperAccuracyBound()
        Gets the device's upper bound for temperature accuracy in Kelvin, temperature values seen above this value have undefined accuracy.
        Returns:
        the maximum kelvin reading that can is within the accuracy spec for the device

      • getLowerAccuracyBound

        public float getLowerAccuracyBound()
        Gets the device's lower bound for temperature accuracy in Kelvin, temperature values seen below this value have undefined accuracy.
        Returns:
        the minimum kelvin reading that can is within the accuracy spec for the device

      • getModelName

        public abstract java.lang.String getModelName()

      • getSerialNumber

        public abstract java.lang.String getSerialNumber()
